intro: Aciotis fragilis, commonly known as the brittleleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and has slender stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small, wind-dispersed seeds. Aciotis fragilis is known for its delicate, fragile appearance and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
